name: Pamela Maginnis
title: Associate Attorney
credentials: M.S., Biomedical Engineering, Johns Hopkins University, 2007
B.S., Chemical Engineering, Carnegie Mellon University, 2005
bio: Pamela Maginnis is a patent attorney with deep technical expertise in biomedical and chemical engineering, making her ideally suited to protect intellectual property in the life sciences and biotechnology industries. With advanced degrees in chemical and biomedical engineering from Carnegie Mellon and Johns Hopkins, Pamela possesses the scientific knowledge necessary to understand complex inventions and draft comprehensive patent applications. As a registered patent attorney, she handles patent prosecution, patent portfolio management, and intellectual property due diligence for biotechnology companies, medical device manufacturers, and pharmaceutical firms. Pamela's practice includes patentability assessments, freedom-to-operate analyses, and patent licensing negotiations. She has particular expertise in medical devices, drug delivery systems, and diagnostic technologies. Pamela regularly works with inventors, researchers, and technology transfer offices to identify and protect valuable intellectual property assets. Her engineering background allows her to communicate effectively with technical teams and understand the commercial potential of emerging technologies. She also handles patent litigation matters and provides strategic advice on intellectual property licensing and commercialization strategies.
